subject: Cybersecurity
title: Digital Signatures: Proving Who Wrote It
description: A short lesson to help you apply Digital Signatures: Proving Who Wrote It.

hook.text: How do you prove an email is genuinely from you â€” not forged by someone who knows your address?

buildup.text: Digital signatures use your private key to sign a message. Anyone with your public key can verify it's authentic.

discovery.text: The process: hash the message, encrypt the hash with your private key. That encrypted hash is the signature.

twist.text: Unlike handwritten signatures, digital signatures also prove the message wasn't altered. Tampering invalidates them.

climax.text: Digital signatures enable secure software updates, legal contracts, and cryptocurrency transactions.

punchline.text: A digital signature proves both who and what.

quiz.question: What does a digital signature prove that a handwritten signature doesn't?
options: That the message wasn't altered after signing
